description: I had the perfect time with friends at this place last night on a brief trip from Seattle to San Francisco. It's on the corner lot of a cute little street.  My Malbec was delicious and priced appropriately.  I'd recommend the combo plate appetizer (great value) as well as the crabcakes. To top it off, the owner was very pleasant and made sure that we had the best experience.  Success.  I would absolutely go to Cafe Meuse when I visit San Francisco again.
author: Ahisha A.

description:
You know, I really like this neighborhood wine bar. Really, I do. The selection is right priced and lovely, the curated tapa like menu is tasty and creditable. Location awesome and interior nicely, if modestly, appointed. Just what you look for in a locals for locals kind of joint. 

But, gotta say it, service level is variable. Better on weekdays than weekends. P'raps this is the nature of the round the corner drinking hole. I get that. But a ten percent betterment in this column would bring me into a strong four-plus rating for this bistro. 

Love this place!
author: S L.

description:
Super cute little wine bar that makes you feel like you've possibly transported to some place in Europe. Good spot for a date, catchup sesh with girlfriends, or a low-key hang out. Extensive wine menu with cheese/charcuterie and more to pair. Bar and table seating. I can't imagine that this place gets super packed - we were here on a Friday around 8 and there were still plenty of seats open.

Come to enjoy and appreciate good wine, paired with good conversation in a comfortable environment.
author: Allie L.

description:
Cafe Meuse is the Perfect Neighborhood Wine Bar.

Nice selection by the glass and bottle at reasonable prices. We met Friends for a glass of Champagne before dinner at Seven Hills, but have just as easily noshed on the nice variety of food offerings. I just wish Cafe Meuse was closer to my apartment!
author: John C.

description:
It's a cozy wine bar in Nob Hill that features a wide selection of wine bottles and flights from the menu, to choose from!

Opt to sit at the window front seating! It's nice to see the outside instead of fixating on the bar or each other, if you know what I mean. (There are options to linger to and from.)

It's good to grab some side bites to compliment the bottle of wine.  Their crostini, slices of fruits and cheese selections, is to delve into while drinking up the wine and doing the norm of chit chattering.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I found my favorite wine!! Its the only place in the city that serves 1448 Red Blend.  I found this place while bar hoping, and now its one of my regular go to spots.  If you want a quaint wine bar, with generous wine samples - I swear they give you nearly a full glass of each sample which is finally enough to properly sample the different options - and yummy nibbles then definitely check this place out.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: I really liked this wine bar! It was super chique and definitely a good place for anyone to hang out and catch up with friends! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! Good vibes and good people
author: Preeti R.

description: Came here with another person for happy hour on a Saturday evening before dinner. Awesome neighborhood spot to get a beer or wine with a delicious plate of charcuterie. 4 glasses of wine + charcuterie came out to about $60 which is pretty solid value. Will definitely be back!
author: Marcel C.

description:
Amazing local wine bar vibe that completed my SF trip. Really, I think I just might want to return to Cafe Meuse when I return to SF.

My travel friend and I discovered Cafe Meuse since we were looking for a local wine bar offering flights. We walked in, saw a table right by the window, was graciously greeted by two staff and waited only a few minutes for them to clean up the table to be seated.

The cafe itself is intimate, a perfect place for a date, or to "wine down" with your friends over a nice glass or two. Loved how the cable cars passed by from time to time.

My friend noticed how large the wine glasses were (oh, bless you SF! Step up your wine game, LA!) Our flights came with 3 glasses of our choice from the menu and the choices offered a wide selection.
author: Bin H.

description: Came here last Friday with my boyfriend for a couple glasses of red wine. Our server was sweet and she let me try some wine recs but I did not like them. I tried the Pinots and they were okay. My boyfriend got a glass of zinfandel and sine I didn't like my tastes, I got a glass of his. Overall, the wine we tried was nothing special. My boyfriend said he felt the same when he came last year with a friend.  The place is cute and it's in a nice area but I prolly wouldn't return.
author: Monica J.

description: My favorite neighborhood wine bar! Really cozy atmosphere. Happy hour every day from 5-7pm. I highly recommend their wine flights as you get to try a few from their menu and they give generous pours for each. The staff is always extremely friendly and helpful.
author: Morgan W.

description: Wow!  What a great little local wine bar.  Though the menu has only a few food options your pallet will be taken on an amazing journey through local bites and tastes.   The staff is amazing, helpful and patient.   If you are in the area (or feel free to go out of your way) this is a must stop on your culinary journey.
author: Jared H.

description:
I don't care much for spiked grape juice these days, but Cafe Meuse is such a cute neighborhood spot, it's hard to resist going in and staying for a few.

I like that it has a casual vibe, has a good selection of wines that's not too overpriced and is more quieter than Amelie on Polk st. Even though this wine bar doesn't have the sexy French guys pouring your drink, you can still count on the attractive locals that call it their second home.

Happy hour is from 5pm - 7pm which means $2 off per glass! that's a big deal, since you can  take your $2, walk over to Trader Joe's nearby and get your two buck chuck! (kidding!)

I love my bubbly so I had their cremant brut rose and my gf decided to try their Kir Royale. Effervescent, light, happy. Three words you need on a Monday night.

We were enjoying ourselves too much and each had a glass of Grüner Veltliner before heading home. When we got our bill, we were charged for a whole bottle. The staff was very apologetic, but make sure to double check your bill. 

I love walking around this neighborhood and will most definitely be back for happy hour again. Cheers.
author: Janice C.

description:
Great service and the food smelled good. Good wine list as well. 

But something needs to be done about the fruit flies. There were four or five of them swarming around my table, so I moved to the bar...where a mosquito promptly landed on my arm and bit me. 

This is a super cute place and I really want to recommend it. But with the bug issue, I likely won't be coming back.
author: Evelyn C.

description: This is the cutest little wine bar with great food and a cozy atmosphere! The owner is extremely friendly and welcoming and will definitely come back!
author: Logan B.

description: Friendly staff. A few more hearty options to the food list would help. Happened to walk in perchance during their happy hour, which is about $2-3 dollars off alcohol. The cheese/charcuterie combo plate is good, a bit pricey though. Great wine selection, but pretty escalated descriptions for the average street-goer poppin' in for a glass, but I must say the waiter's suggestions were on point, and fyi... the brut bubbly was delicious!
author: Lana A.

description: Great local restaurant/bar local vibe that is definitely classy, but not at all uptight. It's a fine place to take a date for drinks or to kick back with friends after a long work day. Their happy hour is good as well. Eric (the owner) is a cool cat as well. I like his style. Always a good time at Meuse!
author: Peter C.

description: Went here on a date. Small spot with nice ambiance, we sat at the bar and got wine and a cheese & charcuterie plate. Bartender gave us some HEFTY pours, thanks girl!
author: Rachel T.

description:
I've been here so many times that I'm long overdue to write this review!

This is my absolute favorite neighborhood wine bar. The setting is intimate, lively, and inviting - the perfect place to meet friends for a very reasonably priced flight and plate of burrata. They like to pour full glasses of wine for the flights, so you're definitely getting your money's worth!

Meuse is constantly switching up wines on their menu, which can be good and bad (if you're hooked on a wine!). My favorite wine on the menu is the Runquist Propriety Blend - a big, earthy red.  

The location is amazing! Nothing better than getting a glass of wine on Hyde before heading out dinner.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Food: So delicious! A great selection of small plates (the burrata, truffle mac and cheese, and cheese plate are all awesome... can you tell I like cheese?) and desserts. As a warning, the ahi tuna tartare is really spicy. The last time I visited, they did last call for food ~9:45 pm.
Wine: Reasonably priced & good selection (all I will comment on as I don't consider myself a wine connoisseur by any means, haha). 
Atmosphere: I think that this is what makes this cafe so special. It's always pretty busy, but feels quaint/comfortable inside and you can watch the cable cars going by on Hyde. They have some outdoor tables as well for warmer nights. It's a great atmosphere to meet up with a couple of friends or a date.
Service: Great! No complaints. Really helpful and kind servers whenever I've gone. 

Happy Hour every day from 5-7PM & on Mondays, every bottle of wine is 20% off.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Cafe Meuse is the perfect spot to grab a glass of wine and share some appetizers with your friends, or your date. Cozy, but not stuffy, great music and decor. Reasonable prices, we did the wine flights which are a great value. The food is delicious! We had the charcuterie plate, burrata bruschetta and the white truffle Mac and cheese (amazing). 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Natalia M.

description: Ordered the cheese plate and beef carpaccio -- delicious!
author: Kayla L.

description:
Me: "Waitress, there's a fly in my wine!"

Waitress: "Oh do you want a spoon?"

Wow. Disgusting.
author: Amy N.

description:
My wife and I moved in nearby and discovered that our neighbor is the owner! We went here on a date.

The place is really cozy, classy but not pretentious.  Prices are reasonable and don't miss the happy hour, 5-7. Great selection of wine.  Definitely great spot for 20's and 30 somethings...
author: Bartek R.

description: Cute wine bar.  The flights are very generous and our server helped us make some selections which was really helpful.  Didn't eat anything but it smelled amazing!
author: Tyler T.

description:
It's a quaint little wine bar along Hyde Street. The few tables outside become super prime property on sunny evenings as you soak in the last bits of sun, relax and sip on some wine/beer, and listen to the "ding ding" of the cable car as it goes by. 

They have a pretty decent selection of wines here from around the world so you'll find something you fancy. While they only have a few beers on tap, I liked that their selection of bottles is pretty good from Californian craft brews to Belgian ales. Happy hour from 5-7 is a nice time to visit; bonus if you score an outside table in the sun. Service is cordial but since it's just one server and another behind the bar, it can be a little slow. 

Still, Cafe Meuse is a nice spot for an evening drink and I hope to remember that it's there more often. Looking forward to coming back to try some of the food too.
author: Jon L.

description: I wish my neighborhood had an equivalent of Cafe Meuse.  When I used to live in Russian Hill, this was a wonderful place to come in, wind down, and enjoy some delicious food and amazing wines.  These days, being in Russian Hill isn't as frequent, but that doesn't mean that Cafe Meuse has changed.  A few girlfriends and I stopped in here for some libations to celebrate the end of the week and what started off as "just one drink" turned into eating almost every small plate on their delicious menu and a few more glasses of wine.  It got a little busy after 6pm, but definitely was still able to get in our food and drink orders without too much of wait or issue.  I love Cafe Meuse (especially their happy hour deals and charcuterie plate), and I definitely think this is a "quieter" and more intimate option than Amelie on Polk. I'll definitely be back!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Can I give you more than 5 stars?
- Perfect San Francisco-local atmosphere (edge of Hyde & Pacific, by the passing cable car)
- Great wine selection, well-priced but with an even better happy hour!
- Burrata Bruschetta is to die for
- Great service
author: Kerry G.

description: Great selection of wines from the Russian River :) Very warm atmosphere. Perfect for glass of wine with a friend.
author: Sonya M.

description: What a great spot in Russian Hill! My wife and I stopped in last night, as we were early for our reservation up the street, and really enjoyed ourselves. The space is great - with a very relaxed, fun atmosphere. Our bartender, Sarah, was so nice and helpful. She recommended a couple awesome glasses of wine - wish we had time to try more! We didn't eat (since we had dinner reservations elsewhere) but the food looked fantastic and everyone who ordered something seemed to be enjoying it. We live in Pac Heights and don't usually make it out this way, but will definitely make a point to come back and visit Meuse soon.
author: Jeff T.

description:
We stopped in last night for a few glasses of wine and dessert before going to the symphony. The atmosphere was lively and welcoming. It had an intimate feeling but you weren't on top of people next to you, even at the bar which is where we were sitting.  

I enjoyed a rosé brut wine, it was a sweeter wine and would highly recommend it. My husband ordered a dark red Cabernet and really enjoyed it. We also ordered the chocolate brownie with a scoop of ice cream on it. Wow!! Totally hit the spot after a lackluster dinner we had at another restaurant. The mix of chocolate with both of our wines was just what we needed! 

The staff was friendly and suggested a few different wines since they didn't have what I usually like to drink. They let me taste two different wines and gave a healthy pour to both. They liked to chit chat with us also which was pleasant. I would definitely come back and check this place out again. I could have spend many hours here enjoying different wines!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Just a quick review to mention this is a great coffee shop, if not a bit pretentious. (The clientele, not the staff.)
Seems to be bustling most of the time, but there's turnover, so if you can hang in there a bit you'll get a seat.
author: Mike C.

description: This is a great wine bar with a good selection of international wines with friendly bartenders. There is seating both at the bar and at probably about 10 tables. We've never had an issue finding a seat. They also have a decent selection of appetizers if you're looking for something to munch on with your wine. Their special on Monday is 25% of any bottle of wine which is a great if you're grabbing drinks with a few friends!
author: Gloria N.

description: Went in a group of four at 10pm on Saturday just to catch the kitchen before it closed.... Such a nice place super cozy beautiful atmosphere the charcuterie was awesome as were the meatballs and you can't go wrong with getting a flight of wine for less than $20. I will definitely be coming back here
author: Stacy A.

description:
Super cute neighborhood wine bar! It's my go to wine bar as it is walking distance from my apartment. The restaurant is relatively small but somehow I am always able to get a table right away. There are also a few tables outside which is nice when it's sunny out. They've got a wide variety of wines and the staff is very helpful with helping you select you wine(s). The food menu is pretty limited but they offer a few good bites to accompany your wine. Their happy hour runs until 7pm too which is a bonus. 

It's a great spot to hand out and drink good wine, my one suggestion is go for apps not a full blown dinner.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Really cute neighborhood spot. Tiny tiny inside, with only a couple tables, seating at the bar and facing the street. Came here on a Thursday and there was live music!

The music was way too loud to carry on normal conversation, so if you have sensitive ears would recommend coming here on another night. Also, prices were a little steep for both wines and cheese plates. Maybe they have a happy hour?
author: Christine E.

description:
Cute place. Stopped in for drinks with some coworkers and ended up staying for about 7 hours! They have some things to munch on which were all delicious and a ton of wine selections. 

Good service, great atmosphere and a great place to sit and enjoy wine with friends.
author: Megan R.

description: Lovely atmosphere. Delicious food. Excellent wine selection. 5 Stars. Christine the bartender is adorable. Perfect spot for a sweet intimate dinner date. I will be back.
author: Raven E.

description: Cafe Meuse is an always friendly neighborhood spot. It preceded many of the newer places along this street but remains a great place to get a glass of wine or non-alcoholic drink, and light dinner or a snack. I wish they would change their menu once in a while, but that's a minor qualm. The friendliness is what wins the day.
author: jen n.

description: Cafe Meuse is one of our favorite wine bars in the city. There is usually never a long wait for a table, and  there's also great price to value, which is not something that I think people usually say about a wine bar. We started with their cheese plate and a glass of wine, and quickly decided to stay and order a full dinner. Other highlights were the charcuterie board and Mac and cheese. Also, hat tip to the staff and waiters. Service was great and super friendly.
author: Harrison L.

description: I came here for wine and apps with a few girlfriends last weekend. While the place is on the smaller side, it is really cozy and has a great ambiance. They have a nice wine selection and all of the apps we got were delicious. I really liked the mac and cheese. I can't wait to come back! It was pretty busy on the Friday night we went, but I think it would be a great date spot on a week night!
author: Lacey L.

description:
A friend and I had planned to try Nook on Friday. When we arrived to find it closed for a private event, we yelped the nearest alternative and voila! we ended up snagging the last outdoor table at Cafe Meuse.

The outdoor tables are in the front, so it's not exactly the relaxing sunny day wine bar patio you're picturing in your head, but it works. Just close your eyes and listen to the soothing sounds of the 12 bus as it rolls by.

I started with a glass of cote du rhone which was very good but just a tad warm. I'm not sure what happened to that bottle because my second glass, a rockpile rose, was a perfect temperature. Both delicious. They have a great list with a lot of variety.

We split a meat and cheese plate which was amazing and plenty for 2. Charcuterie and cheese has got to be my favorite thing ever. 

Service was ok, it seemed like they only had 1 server working the whole restaurant but we weren't in a hurry.

Would 100% return.
author: Rachel E.

description: Cute little wine bar in Nob Hill! They have a good menu with small plates and their wine menu is not overpriced like other wine bars in this area. Perfect spot for happy hour or while you wait for a table at a nearby restaurant.
author: Rachel C.

description: Favorite wine bar, conveniently located one block from our apartment! Great wine selection and food, friendly people, cozy atmosphere. Thanks guys!
author: Emily H.

description:
Total hidden gem! My friend and I had a cheese plate and drinks here while we waited for our reservation at seven hills.  Cafe Meuse turned out to be the better part of the night.

The cheese plate was the best I've ever had - loved all 4 cheese.  The best part was actually the in-house made crostini. We ate about 4 servings of it and I even wanted to buy more (unfortunately they can't sell them!) In addition, there was live jazz music! 

Sounds like from the other reviews you shouldn't go here for dinner. But definitely come get a cheese plate with crostinis and some drinks to enjoy the jazz music!
author: Alice Z.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Love the small plate menu (one of the best bar menus in my opinion) and great wine selection. Very European vibe.
author: Pamplemouse L.

description:
My girlfriend and I strolled in here this past Wednesday for the first time to grab a drink while we waited for a table at elephant. We were greeted by our server who told us to make ourselves comfortable at a high top by the window. From the time we sat down to the time we left, we had a wicked good time. Very intimate, great wine and food, and service goes above and beyond. Alex was very knowledgeable about the wine and took the time to teach us a little bit as well (my girlfriend loves learning about wine). She made great recommendations for what we were looking for. We would let her pick out a different wine each time we ordered and it was hella on point each time. The other bartender (I think Steve was his name) was hilarious and made us feel like we were regulars. We were having such a great time that we cancelled our reservations at elephant and spent the rest of our night here. The charcuterie plate was delicious. A great portion of meat and cheese for a good price. The meatballs are on point and hit the spot. I recommend this place to anyone looking for an intimate place for small plates and great wine. The neighborhood is great as well. 

We decided to bring our friends in tonight and our experience was just as nice as the first. Can't wait to come back!
author: Alan T.

description:
A perfectly spacious yet intimate wine bar that doesn't have you packed in like sardines while trying to relax and enjoy wine like some other places in the city. Came in on a Saturday night and got a nice high-top table for two to grab a glass of wine before dinner.  I had a cab blend that was delicious and the price point was to be expected.  The place was full but not crowded (large group of girlfriends and lots of couples) and had a great vibe. 

 The service was not great (slow, forgot waters) but as this was our first time there and it was a Saturday, I'm not going to base my review off of that as the environment and wine were great.  It's right around the corner from the boy's new spot, so I can see return visits (happy hour?!) in the future.
author: Raina D.

description: Nice place. Nice Space. Cold and Rainy outside. Warm and Comfy inside. Serving up great anti pastas and cheese plates. Wine wine wine ... So nice! Bring on the romance! Christine the hostess with the mostest took special care we had a wonderful time. No need to hold any star power back!
author: Harry P.

description: Love this place. Good service, great selection of wines and reasonably priced small plates of food. Their mac & cheese with white truffles is to die for. The atmosphere is cozy, I can always find a free table and as the music is not too loud, so it's easy to chat. They also have a few tables outside. A great neighborhood place!
author: Heidi L.

description:
Love this place! Fav Wine Bar in The neighborhood. It gets pretty packed Thursday - Sat, make sure to get there early :).

Great for Date night or girls night out. 

If you like Live Music visit this place on Thursday nights for some salsa/ live music! 

If you like full body red wines try the Syrah or the Malbec :)
author: Sepi N.

description: Hidden gem in the heart of Russian Hill. Cozy atmosphere, good wine selection, and excellent service. Great spot for a date!
author: Stefan B.

description: Great wine, great apple pie, great port, waitress laughed at my jokes (Natalie). Stick a needle in me, I'm happy
author: Simon M.

description: Always has Lagunitas on tap and between 5-7 they have a great $4 draft beer happy hour. I've only eaten there twice but it was good both times. Lauren serves us every time we go there and she's always awesome.
author: Mark Y.

description: Cheese plate was amazing! Manchego, Dubliner cheddar, French Brie, Blue cheese, toasted nuts, fresh & dried fruits. I also enjoyed a glass of Pinot as well. Every Monday they have 25% bottles of wine. The layout and decor was relaxing and chill. Not overly crowded for small venue. Will def come back!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Great fast service. Great ambiance. Get a window seat to crowd watch and see cable cars.
author: chris r.

description: On a low key Tuesday night, Cafe Meuse was the perfect spot to enjoy my dinner in Nob Hill. It has a cozy interior, complete with high tables and a bar, plus a few small tables outside. A great date spot by the looks of it. As for food, I ordered the Hyde St. Chicken Satay. It was a delicious plate, paired well with a glass of pinot gris. With tip the entire meal for one came in around $25. Will definitely return again.
author: Roberto S.

description:
No ! Don't waste your money coming here if you intend to eat. 
Good place to grab a wine but the food was simply horrible. Had the chicken satay which was dry and cold. Peanut sauce was too thick. 

My friend had the salad which was average. Wine too was expensive compared to Nook - which is close by. Skip on this place and go to Nook
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Oh man, I love this place. I come here at least once a month, usually for girls' night, and it's pretty special. Here are some of my favorite things:

1. DIY flights!
2. Good and cheap bites
3. For some reason, there is always the perfect amount of seating
4. Nice mix of wine specials
5. Fun and friendly staff

and, perhaps most importantly:

6. I think this is a common place for blind dates / other first dates, and therefore provides incredible people watching. 

I don't know if Cafe Meuse is objectively better than every other wine bar in SF, but it is 100% my neighborhood hangout.
author: A O.

description: Love the atmosphere and the wine selection; a perfect date spot any night of the week! If you can't settle on a wine, go for a flight, you won't regret it! I've never had a bad experience at this lovely neighborhood spot -- just hope they get that Sangiovese back that I discovered circa summer 2013.
author: Ada K.

description:
Great food, great selection of wine, and the staff is super knowledgeable about the wines on their menu. I love having a glass of wine here outside and watching the cable cars. 

My favorite apps are the charcuterie plate, truffle mac and cheese and the tomato soup with crab.
author: Deepti A.

description:
Such a little gem!! They really do have a great spot and some wonderful selections. I loved doing a flight of their Pinot Noirs. Super fabulous finger foods to go with the wines! The Charcuterie was so good that I had to order two! We brought our daughter along and they even worked out a little bowl of plain pasta and parmesan cheese for her...that was so totally great of them to do!!

I am looking forward to our next visit sans the kidlit so we can try more wines. :-)
author: Colleen C.

description:
This is exactly what a wine bar should be. Intimate, relaxed, and good service. 

Even on a Saturday night, it wasn't very crowded and we immediately got seating (though I'm hoping that doesn't mean that the place isn't doing well). That's a definite plus considering we passed up 20+ bars on Polk that were packed to the gills.

The wine selection was good considering the size of the place; it's not a huge selection like some other wine bars in SF have, but it's a good number for a neighborhood wine bar.

Ambiance is an important factor in wine bars, so allow me a small section to talk about that. The room was nicely lit; dark enough that it felt intimate and not so dark that you can't see the expressions of the person in front of you. There was music to fill silences, but thankfully it wasn't very loud. The bathroom was spotless. 

Long story short, it was perfect. I've wanted to open a wine bar for a long time, and it couldn't be any better than this place.
author: Akash K.

description:
I wish I knew our servers name, because she provided our group of six with the best service I've had in the city in a long time. She was able to memorize flights of wine and food orders, kept our water and wine full and checked on us constantly while we told stories, laughed and had a great time. The bar was full and I was surprised how attentive she was. 

We also tried the Cheese plate, olive mixture (which included a few more exotic olive types in it), and the chicken satay which came with a free side salad that was delicious. Chicken was moist and we ate every last bite. They have cheep beers too! Most are $5-6 and even Chimay which is normally $10, was $8 here.

Free bread too.
author: Michael M.

description: Love the generous pours! $2 off all drinks at happy hour, and happy hour is 5-7pm everyday.
author: Jess C.

description:
It was my first time here and this place was amazing!! I came here a month ago to celebrate my birthday with friends and it was SUCH a great experience and a WONDERFUL evening :) I've been lagging on writing a review but I felt like not writing one would just be rude...! 
Everyone was so nice, Kindly accommodating, and the service was terrific!! All this amidst the cutest scenic SF views with the perfect intimate ambiance :) Food was great as well!

Thank you to everyone at Cafe Meuse for making making my birthday dinner with my best friends an extra special and memorable experience!
author: Bonnie H.

description:
4.5

DRINK
Red Wine

SERVICE;
Good

ATMOSPHERE:
Love this cute lil wine bar ;P On Hyde, few outdoor seating, watch the cable cars go by.. 


10.18
author: Angela L.

description: My experience at the café was absolute perfection. I couldn't believe how kind, helpful and responsive the staff was - particularly given how busy Friday night was!The place is small but it's set up well and the menu is delightful. The beef carpaccio as well as the apple crisp were portion perfect - the former being light and the latter absolutely decadent. Neither felt overthought. Desserts are baked one-off, giving the feeling that everything sweet is prepared with love.
author: Mercy B.

description:
Café Meuse is a cozy, classy wine bar is a fantastic place to go for a delicious glass (or two) of wine.  I last visited Café Meuse on a Friday night - it was much less crowded than I would have expected and was a great place to catch up with a friend.  Service was quick and friendly, pours were *very* generous (especially given the price), the ambiance was that of a standard wine bar (comfy, dimly lit), and the selection was excellent.  I also ordered the crème brulee dessert, which was the perfect dessert compliment to the wine.

All in all, Café Meuse is a great place to drop by for a drink - I will definitely be back soon!
author: Rishi N.

description:
Katie on Monday nights is awesome! 

As soon as my glass is getting low Katie is right there to ask if I'd like another (which is usually the case)
author: Cescilia A.

description: I suggest you take a pick from their smartly curated wine list and pair it with some of their tasty cured charcuterie. (Is that redundant? Is all charcuterie cured or is none of it? I don't care. I've got a sickness and the only cure is more puns!)
author: Ames B.

description:
Yummy----- 

OK---so the beer is cold and the owner really nice (a former NYer like me). The cheese platter was as beautiful as it was tasty. The chicken satay was sooooooo good. 5 pieces (I think) and they were VERY tender. 

Also the cole-slaw that accompanied the chicken satay was so good the wife and I argued over it (those pesky spouses !!!).... 

The bread was amazing dipped in their olive oil and balsamic 

I love local places like this. Fully support them !!! 

PS-----Rachael, the server, was sooooooooo professional and sweet.
author: Chris O.

description: Came here last night with a friend and all we had to do was walk by and peek inside and were sold on how adorable it is. We wanted a cozy, almost European feel where we could catch up and talk and this was perfect. The 4 stars are for the atmosphere, drinks and service - I didn't get to try the food so I can't rate it a perfect 5. Our waitress was attentive, they had a great selection of wine and the food we did see looked amazing. I'd definitely come back here and that to me, is the mark of a successful business considering how many other wine bars there are to check out.
author: Regina S.

description:
love going to Nob Hill.  There are so many cute wine bars around that area.  I came her for Happy hour and again for after dinner drinks.  They don't stay open very late but if there is a good crowd and everyone is having a good time, then the owner and staff would keep the bar open a little longer. How sweet!

The staff really understand wine and was really helpful! I really appreciate the knowledge they have to share and the great wine selection they have.  Great place to hangout and catch up!
author: Ying F.

description: Excellent service, shame to see the montepulciano go :( but there are more important things in life than wine right :D
author: David A.

description: Surprisingly delightful! We stopped off because it was on our way home and had a few drinks and dessert. The creme brûlée was yummy, and the staff were friendly and welcoming. I was a huge fan of the ambiance. We'll definitely be coming back again! Especially with these happy hour deals!
author: Mario G.

description:
As long as there is something I could be procrastinating, I'll write this review. Last night, after Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences in Golden Gate Park, we decided the night just wasn't over yet and went in to have a drink.

Thankfully (and not thankfully), Cafe Meuse has ladies night! Buy one glass, the second for the ladies are free! (She didn't believe my boyfriend was a girl...:|) I was already mildly buzzed from Nightlife, but I've been here when I was sober once before and the entire space is warm and comforting. Their menu looks great--I asked the boyfriend to let me get the seasonal berries with chantilly cream but he said no :(

Instead we got the warm figs wrapped in prosciutto. Did I think it was delicious? Yes. Could I stop thinking about someone telling me that figs were considered evil in the eyes of God? Not really, that one was difficult. But why would God hate figs? He's not a communist, I think those assholes were lying. 

Stupid religious fanatics trying to propagate their fig-hating agenda.

Come here, enjoy it and everything else because it's worth it, but for the love of God and his fig-loving nature, please stop at the first glass if you're not feeling very well. Chances are the second glass, despite being free, will not make it any better.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Wine is great, Food took FOREVER!
Service was nice but not attentive.  Ironically we were sitting in the dead center of the venue.  Risotto burned our tongues when it finally came out.
author: Est K.

description: Cafe Meuse is everything I want out of a wine bar.  Great location in the heart of Russian Hill on Hyde Street. They have a daily HH on wines by the glass and beer.  The staff has always been lovely.  There is indoor/outdoor seating and a variety of menu items to pair with your wine. I haven't tried any of the food yet, but given my positive experiences visiting for a glass of wine, I'm sure it won't be long...
author: Brianna M.

description: Went here the other night. It was a lovely evening that called for a glass of wine while sitting outside at a sidewalk cafe. This is the perfect place in this neighborhood for exactly that!  I got the cab sauv, which was solid, and the charcuterie, which was good.  Surprisingly, the chicken satay was excellent and the brownie a la mode was deeply satisfying!
author: Riz W.

description:
I've passed by this cute wine bar so many times when driving on Hyde and when contemplating where to go for an after dinner drink on Friday, I suggested this place to my friend. It's a small, but typical wine bar, dimly lit - and crowded but not so that you can't find a seat or get served quickly. The night we were there was great for people watching (read: some great drunks) and service was excellent (and funny as the server commiserated with us on some of the trainwrecks in the bar).

I had the pick any three white wines flight for $15 and chose the three chardonnays. All were excellent and I've got to say - it was $15 well spent as the pours were MORE than generous. Highly recommend - and will definitely be back!
author: Jen L.

description:
This place is fabulous!!

We came here for my best friend's birthday, there were 8 of us, we all arrived at different times the waitress was incredibly accommodating for how obnoxious we are. The ambiance was perfect, it was quiet, we all could have a conversation at normal volume- which seems funny to remark on but it wasn't like we felt weird using normal voices and laughing it was just that we could hear each other. 

I was one of the late arrivals, my wonderful friends already ordered my a nice glass of Zin and courteously saved cheese, bread and olive oil for me. The wine selection was great and mostly moderately priced. The menu was small, which is nice because you know they are specializing things for the evening.

I ordered this tomato crab soup which was delicious, everyone seemed as happy as I was with their food.

All in all it was a great evening, I will definitely go again and again.
author: Veronica T.

description:
You know how you put things off and put things off, and then try them and wonder why the hell you waited so long?

Café Meuse was one of those places for me. My beau and I finally stopped in last night, and I am sorry I put it off. 

The wine portions were generous (he had a killer zin, and I indulged in some bubbles), and the cheese plate had just the right amount of everything, including the all-important bread-to-cheese ratio.  The prices were reasonable, and the ambience was pretty much perfect for a date night or drink with close friends. To top it all off, our waitress was witty, amusing, and attentive at all the right times.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Michi K.

description:
Had a great glass of wine and some snacks with some girlfriends at Cafe Meuse the other night.  The place was steadily packed and rowdy, the food was beautifully presented and delicious, and the windows on two sides were lovely for pretending to be drinking wine in a European cafe, instead of one down the street.
The lone waitress however, was pretty slammed which made service frustratingly slow, and a wee bit forgetful (we never got the water we asked for).  It's a good thing we were only having that one glass of wine and not wanting anything else, because once we received it and were finished, we practically had to stand on the table to get her attention for the check.
A nice spot, but be prepared to wait if it's busy.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
One of my favorite wine bars in the city. Had to write a review because I went last night and they had on special (mouth watering) sausage stuffed mushrooms. I had one of their Zinfandel's which was great as well.  

Other than that, I live close by and love going with friends as it's a classy place with fun art work and great staff!
author: Kristin W.

description:
Cafe Meuse has a really great wine selection.  I haven't tried a glass I haven't liked...though I must admit, I haven't gotten all THAT adventurous, but I have paid them over a handful of visits and consistently try new wines.

The servers are all nice and knowledgeable; however, ordering the dishes seems to result in quite a wait time.  And when you ask for water, make sure to specify you want it for the table, otherwise, they will only bring you one glass...something I had never really seen before.

Great atmosphere, very cute, dim lit place featuring fun and changing art.  The cable car goes right by outside, great spot to come by for a glass of wine...or three!
author: Janelle C.

description: My friend and I checked this place out today. It was a perfect Sunday afternoon. We sat outside and watched the people and cable cars come by. The waiter, who I'm guessing was also the owner,  was exceptionally welcoming and gave us some samples of wine to decide what to pick on the second round. Will definitely be back!
author: Ryan F.

description: What a great place! I've walked past here for almost three years and finally decided to give it a try. The atmosphere was fun and light, everyone in there was having a great time. The service was prompt, the servers were knowledgeable and friendly. Great place to grab a glass of wine before dinner or meet up with some girlfriends. I'll definitely be back
author: Victoria W.

description: Amazing experience! Food and wine both phenomenal. Definitely recommend getting the flight of red wine. Waiters are great at recommendations. Ambiance of the restaurant was delightful. Can't wait to go back
author: Katie S.

description:
I stopped in this spot for dessert rather than wine, but it was still a good choice.

I had a crème brulee which was rich with that custard flavor, but also had a decent dose of vanilla.  The place was filled with a cool crowd and had a very relaxed setting.

Since my first experience was great, I'd definitely go back again, but next time I'll try the wine.
author: Ken G.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have often walked past this place, and decided to give it a try with some other friends.  I really liked the fact that it was happy hour and it wasn't totally slammed with people. :)  I ordered a Lagunitas and the salmon risotto, and both were tasty.  A great place to catch up with friends, and not run into "the scene". ;)
author: Mel G.

description:
I'm conflicted. I want to tell you about it, but I dont want it to become this big crowded/trendy deal, because the vibe of it right now is so awesome... 

Excellent wine selection + extremely friendly staff who goes above & beyond + perfect easy/conversational atmosphere = new favorite.  

Love this place! 

I'd give it a 6/5 if I could.
author: Jodie B.

description:
Love it! The ambiance was great for a place to sit an relax with a great glass of wine. Perfect date spot. 

I had the '07 Cabernet Sauvignon. Shannon was a great bartendar in the midst of a busy night.
author: Eric B.

description:
Take the cable car up the hill to Hyde with your Clipper card like a true SF local and tuck yourself into this little, neighborhood wine bar. Although, I have to say that the beer selection is also really good.

If your eating, the menu is really well thought out and is the perfect amount to go with libations. The cheese plates have lots of little extras like dried fruit and quince that do not always make the cut at other places. 

Staff is always friendly and the setting is just small enough to seem intimate but also have enough room for a small crowd. The wine list always has a few new bottles of something I haven't seen before which is a welcome surprise. 

I also feel conflicted because I don't want the place to get over run but it is one of those places where you can sit and have a conversation and there isn't DJ music blaring, so if that's what your after, go for it. Polk street is also a hop skip and a jump away if the night takes a different turn...
author: Jimi G.

description: Great wine selection and cozy ambiance. Neighborhood gem.
author: Janice W.

description:
I definitely think this place is more wine bar than restaurant; I should have been able to tell by the pictures on the Yelp listings page, but my friends and I optimistically hoped we would eat dinner there.

One of the great things is that it's a quick and easy place to pop in for a glass of wine and a snack/light dinner.  My friends and I had a couple of glasses of wine and then a number of appetizers.  We had the cheese plate, stuffed mushrooms, ahi tuna, fresh mozzarella and tomatoes and the artichoke dip.  The stuffed mushrooms and cheese plate were my faves; the artichoke dip was good but not the best I've ever had.  The food was all generally tasty but the portions were small (especially relative to the price).

The service is super friendly and nice...and so are the patrons!  I ran into my friend and her family, and everyone was chatting with each other like we were old friends by the end of the meal.  The place is tiny and cute and definitely a great place to grab a drink (not much of a wait at all on a Friday night).

As one of my friends said at the end of the meal, this definitely isn't cheap.  I'd definitely recommend going for a snack (not when you're REALLY hungry as I was).  But the best part is ladies' night on Wednesdays - two for one glasses of wine, and there aren't really any rules!  They don't have to be the same glass of wine and you can do buy-one-get-one-free with your friend!
author: Wendy L.

description: Music, chill energy, wine, small yummy plates (we almost ate the plates too) and a cute little spot on a corner with good service.
author: Helen K.

description: I waited 1 hour 25 minutes for my food only to get the wrong dish, then waitor then showed up w no utensils! I wont step back in here
author: Sebastian R.

description:
The first time I went to Cafe Meuse, it was on the recommendation of my friend's coworkers.  Admittedly, I was skeptical of what a "Ladies' Night" would be like, because at most bars, it means a lot of desperate types trying really hard to get noticed.  I was really pleasantly surprised that the crowd was super low-key and mainly just people enjoying conversation with each other or out on dates.  Not skeezy at all, or like what I imagined at first.  

I have been to the cafe twice now, and love the food, wine, and atmosphere.  The wine list is fantastic, with wines from Northern California and around the world.  This makes the 2 for 1 Ladies' Night special a smokin deal.  The charcuterie platter is really good, and the tomato soup topped with crabmeat is really rich and delicious.  Despite the high-end food and wine list, it is really laid back and unpretentious.  Definitely will be back!
author: Natalie C.

description: In General, this intersection in Russian Hill has a very neighborhood friendly feeling. I cant say it is hidden but it certainly has a cozy feeling to it, add a wine bar with a great menu, you can end up staring out the window for hours as you polish off your bottle/S :)
author: Kajal P.

description: My local wine bar. It's super cute with decent wines. They have a really yummy tomato soup with a lump of crab in it.  They often have live music that's really good too.
author: Mahta P.

description: The Cafe sits on a perfect corner on Nob Hill with the cables cars gliding by.  Yes the wine and service are great here.  The real story, oddly enough, it the food!  I have NO idea how they make such delicious dishes for such a small kitchen.  You have to have dessert too.  We always go for the wine, but sit in amazement over the food.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Guys - are you always in search of a place that is not a total sausage-fest? Well - allow me to introduce you to Ladies night at Cafe Meuse on Thursdays. Trust me - it's a goldmine for single guys! 

I came here last Thursday night with a few girlfriends and this place was packed with ladies. This neighborhood gem is cozy, romantic and reasonably priced. The wine list is well-chosen (try the tempranillo... it's amazing!) and the food menu is delectable (mushroom stuffed w/ sausage, tuna tartar, salumi plate or cheese platter). You can't go wrong checking out the scene on Thursday nights!
author: Alice W.

description:
Went here for the first time with friends last week. AMAZING totally catered to multiple food allergies, specifically gluten intolerance, and did so with ease. 

Amazing BLT salad, cheese plate and the pot de creme was just killer! Definitely check this place out - great wine selection as well!
author: Renee P.

description: Adorable little neighborhood wine bar. Great wine selection, and a nice selection of food items to match. The prices are reasonable - especially when considering the $2 off for Happy Hour. I was the only one in there on a Thursday night around 7PM (which is also a Ladies' Night) - I hope they get more business!
author: Zsuzsa B.

description:
Nice wine bar on Russian Hill.  Spent about three hours there last week...about 1/2 that time just reading a book and the other half talking to other patrons.

House carafe of red wine was very good.
author: Stephen B.

description: I absolutely love their happy hour! I went in and saw that the wine I wanted was still going to be $9 however, when she poured the giant glass I felt like I'd gotten a deal! I'm talking very large. Their food looked really delicious, but we didn't end up trying it. I think this will be a fun local spot to hang out and meet up!
author: Emily S.

description: I pass Cafe Meuse on my way to the bus stop each morning, but didn't go in until recently. The unassuming wine bar is a nice little spot in Nob Hill, and the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The menu is full, but not overwhelming and the small plates are delicious (we got the cheese platter... the blue cheese is incredible!). Most glasses of wine range from $9-$12, the atmosphere is relaxed and the food a perfect compliment to the wine. Definitely recommend!
author: Kate B.

description: This is a cute wine bar tucked into my favorite area of Russian Hill. Honestly, I tried to eat at Zarzuela first, but the hour wait led me to Cafe Meuse...and Im so glad it did! My friend and I enjoyed a delicious glass of wine. I chose a Pinot Noir and she had the Syrah. We also shared the truffle mac and cheese, and when it took much longer than expected, the super friendly bartenders poured us a complimentary glass each. I can't wait to visit again!
author: Kim O.

description:
SO ADORABLE. The ambiance is cozy, chic, and romantic with candles and little lights beautifully decorating the walls. The crowd was 8 girls and 2 guys on a Wednesday night, but what can you expect? I think this place does tend to lean toward a female-heavy clientele though.

A fabulous date place!
author: Amy D.

description:
When I told the boy over gchat that I was going out for a ladies night, his exact response was: "Don't talk to any boys, they've all got syphillis."

Men needn't fear for the potential of a girlfriend's eyes to wander at Cafe Meuse, especially on a Thursday "Ladies Night." Of the twenty five to thirty people that were in the bar last night, only two were men. And they were both clearly on dates. 

With a 2 for 1 deal, however, it's a wonder that more guys don't skeeve around looking for drunken women. My group of nine was literally fall down drunk by the end of our evening: thank goodness for the soft cushions or one of the girls would have a nasty bump on her forehead.

Over the course of a couple of hours, we all made great use of the 2 for 1 deal, and I enjoyed a riesling, cabernet, sauvignon blanc, and a rose for about $20. I can't remember the winery labels but I do recall them all tasting delicious in filled-to-the-brim pours. We were impressed with our waitress; doubly so when we asked for information about a particular wine and she responded "I'm not exactly sure, this is my first day." If this is how the service is with someone who just started, I gleefully look forward to what someone with a little more experience can do. 

All in all, a great spot that resulted in me writing a very drunken email to my now-abroad boy about how he had nothing to worry about with ladies night at Cafe Meuse. And that if nothing else, I'm scared to death of syphillis anyway.
author: Devon S.

description: We went there for happy hour with $2 off each glass. Very generous wine pours although the wines by the glass selection was limited. I'd go back though if I was in the area.
author: Carol M.

description: I only ordered one glass of wine here, and although it was tasty, that's not why I enjoy this place.  I love the location, the selection, the ambiance, the upbeat crowd, and the great service. Cafe Meuse is the type of place I'd like to come back to for Happy Hour or for a glass of wine during the day. I also happened to go with my boyfriend, but saw a lot of groups of girls there...so maybe a girls night would be better? All in all, it's a memorable little spot, so I want to introduce this place to more people!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I had a horrible experience with the drunken manager there and am never coming back.
 
I used to think this was a great little place until one night my friend and I stopped in for a Ladies Night glass of wine and had to deal with the slurry speeched, bleary eyed, rude manager. In response to a question we had about our bill, he mumbled 'you just don't get it... and you never will.'
 
...And he just won't get my business again- he never will
author: Gosia L.

description: The host/bartender was a real jerk last night.  We asked if it was still happy hour and he looked at his watch and went psshhtt. Real snooty attitude. But waitress was nice and they had good wine. Decent food. A little expensive.
author: kyle j.

description:
I came here for drinks with a friend who lives in the area. Really relaxed bar with an unpretentious feel. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable when I asked for a wine recommendation and I didn't feel rushed or crowded as I enjoyed my drink. 

Great for a calm night out, or a date with someone you actually want to talk to.
author: Madeline N.

description: I *love* this place. It is only one block from our house so that probably has something to do with it, but I lovelovelove this place. The first time I was here I actually sent my glass of wine back bc I didn't like it - I know, I know, I judge myself for doing that...but the server saw the look on my face and asked if I wanted something different! She was so cool about it, just wanted to make sure that we enjoyed our experience. And of course we did.
author: Ashley T.

description:
A great neighborhood wine bar with good noshes and a versatile wine list. One of my favs! 
Rachel is an awesome bartender - always friendly, and always spot-on in her recommendations. 
Also, can't beat 2-for-1 on ladies night!
author: Jax R.

description:
So I planned a private party for my family for 40 people for the holidays at Cafe Meuse and it was outstanding.  The owner Eric was so attentive, accomodating and easy to work with.  The atmosphere was charming as you watch the cable cars go by and the staff was very hospitable to all our guests, young and old.  
The wine and beer selection offered was perfect for the event and Eric put together a nice charcuterie spread for my guests.  
It was a perfect celebration, I will definitely keep them in my list of great places.
author: Jeanne M.

description: Tiny little place with nice wine and tasty food.  The band was very very loud
author: Poppy C.

description:
2-for-1 Ladies Night every Thursday!

Didn't make the mistake of ordering any red wine this time (I don't like red wine, I don't know why I keep forgetting this) and stuck with the whites and it was gooood. Got a riesling to start and finished with a nice, girly, bubbly, sparkling shiraz. Yes, it appears I am a wine wuss.

(But at least I was a wine wuss who only had to pay $9 for two drinks!)
author: Cynthia T.

description: Nice wine bar!  Great wine list and it's on a nice corner with plenty of good people watching.   Hip electronic plays in the background while cute women enjoy their wine...
author: Michael H.

description:
This is an awesome wine bar. The cool thing is they serve a variety of foods like chacuterie plates, and lox toast points, which make it a really awesome after work / pre-dinner layover point. We always have a great time here and get pretty silly on vine. I think this would be a really great place to take a date, especially on Thursdays when they have a half price ladies special. The place has that off the beaten path, neighberhood feel which feels like an intimate secret spot that will make your date dripping wet that you really know what you are doing as a man. Another major bonus is the outdoor cafe style seating and the fact that the Hyde street trolley passes by - it's like getting drunk in an 80s rice-a-roni commercial, and you can people watch tourists from Ohio with really bad shirts.

For beer drinkers they offer a variety of nice ales, which is good for those that discriminate against the vines. The wait staff is always good and attentive. My liver doesn't thank me that I come here way more often than I probably should, but it's also on my walk to work so fuck it.
author: Andreas T.

description: Cafe Meuse overcharged my credit card.  When I called them, they did not address the issue and did not return my call.  Check your statements!
author: Kiana M.

description: This review pertains to the wine and the atmosphere. I stopped by this adorable place with a friend after a hectic day for a drink. Lucky for me that day was a Monday and bottles of wine are 25% off, perfect! We sat outside, enjoyed a few glasses and chatted. The bartender came out often enough to see if we needed anything but let us alone to talk and hang out. While I didn't eat, the food looks good. If I am in the neighborhood I will stop by for drinks again anytime.
author: Shanna T.

description: Great wine selection and I love the $2.00 off wine for happy hour! Also, the girl who is usually working is great at helping you choose a glass you'll enjoy, but since she's usually working alone you may have to wait a bit for a 2nd glass, she's very fast though given she's the only one there. I love sitting at the table by the window while watching the cable car and good looking well dressed people walk by.
author: Natalie M.

description: Initially we were headed for Amelie, but found it closed for repairs, so we walked a couple of blocks and ended up here. Looked charming and inviting from the outside, and indeed it is! We were just in time for happy hour (5pm-7pm) where you get $2 off every glass of wine (6oz pour). Scanning their menu, they also have "flight" specials where you can choose 3-4 red or white wines (3oz pours of each) of your choice for $15-$20. Our server was by herself this day, but did a stellar job of waiting on every table and even took time to give us recommendations since it was really hard to decide on what to choose. My friend and I each enjoyed a glass of wine and shared a small plate of beef carpaccio with baby greens. Really cozy and intimate setting - perfect for dates or small groups. My rating may go up as I make more trips here, but for now I am a definite fan and shall return soon!
author: Elaine W.

description:
I want to love this place. I really, really, really want to love this place. It's in possibly the most idyllic San Francisco-esque little spot - with a gorgeous interior that is chic, and beautiful, yet cozy, warm and comfortable. It reminds me of Europe.

It's quaint and lovely with views of the passing cable cars, and is hidden among branches of the Hyde Street canopy. 

But - they have a bit of a disappointing wine list... and worse yet, I don't think they keep the freshest bottles open. I've been here at least three times and have had just bad glasses of wine. Whether it was the varietal, or the fact that the wine was not at a good temperature, I can't say...but either way, it's just sad. 

I will probably give it another chance or two, just for the fact that they have an incredible location, but they are just not my cup of tea - although they might fare better with tea instead of wine.
author: Erin M.

description:
Who knew this little treasure was so close to me all this time!  Finally stopped in and enjoyed some wine and chitter chatter with a friend of mine.  Love the ambiance, small, dark, and cozy.  Very charming little wine bar with tasty nibbles to choose from on the menu, all reasonably priced as well.

This is definitely the place to go to if you are feeling like catching up with a friend or having a glass of wine.  Definitely low-key and mellow.
author: Jennifer H.

description: had a wonderful time here with the boyfriend last week. the waitress was super nice and adorable. food was awesome and wine was good. would definitely visit again!
author: Cydney S.

description: Love this little wine bar! The wine is excellent and the truffle Mac n Cheese is the best I've ever had hands down! Definitely go with friends because the wait staff isn't the friendliest, but still nice.
author: Alexandra Z.

description:
This is a revised review.

Generally I find the list to be average and somewhat overpriced. This is a place for people who don't know much about wine. In other words, I think that for each category of wine offered, there's probably a lot of wine out there that's significantly better than what's on the menu. But the average customer won't notice. 

Some of the things on the list just don't indicate to me that good choices are being made when it comes to selection. Paul Autard is a bad sign in any establishment- especially when there is so much good, cheap wine coming out of the Southern Rhone. That there's a ruby port on the dessert list is another bad sign. Ruby port belongs in the same category as cheap asti, lambrusco, and liebfraumilch.

We ordered a beef carpaccio for $9 that had about $0.20 worth of arugula and maybe a dollar's worth of thinly sliced beef. It was pretty flavorless.

I think there's probably potential for improvement here, but I wasn't happy with my first experience.
author: Max B.

description:
On Bastille Day, sick of listening to my co-worker learn French on Rosetta Stone, part of me wanted to walk into Cafe Meuse wearing an American Flag and order sparkling wine and freedom fries.

But I didn't.  

Instead, I restrained myself and decided that since my friend Beau G. is part French - not all of them can be evil - and I should embrace his people.   

I opted for Anchor Steam, a cheese plate, and freshly baked bread.  Dinner of champions - and the reason I have this booty.

Dimly lit, reasonable prices, and stumbling distance to chode central..err... Russian Hill. 

4 Stars.  Find me someone to freedom kiss and I'll bump it up to 5.
author: Janney B.

description:
It was Thursday night and the group thought to themselves "hmmmm, I wonder where we should take the visiting parents for dinner. Lets check Yelp, they will surely have a suggestion"

And thus began the journey for dinner in Nob Hill. After calling a few 4-5 star places, at 9 PM (those Europeans eat late you know), the group settled on Cafe Meuse because it was close, looked nice and they could take the party of 6, according to the girl on the phone, in 40 minutes. 

So they waited and had some wine and eventually began their stroll to dinner. Upon arrival the group was pleasantly surprised at the nice warm dark decor but shocked to find that the "table" for six was actually the bar that comfortably seats 5. They were hungry so they decided cozy was okay. 

One person in the group was a wine rep, and seemed to find their list acceptable for a wine bar. This same wine rep was afflicted with a very severe shellfish allergy and when she asked the waitress to verify that shellfish would not be touching the other 15 small plates the group had ordered the waitress replied, quite rudely "I have no idea, I don't work in the kitchen". 

Still trying to make the most of the evening, and show the visiting parents a nice time, another person asked if the waitress could ask the chef about this matter, since she had made it very clear to the group that she was not the kitchen staff. The waitress apparently wasn't speaking to the chef because she told the group "I can't ask and can't guarantee this, the kitchen is small."

One person in the group, at this point, went to the kitchen herself to ask, all the while being yelled at by the waitress. Once the waitress realized she would actually have to go into the kitchen and  get an answer gave up her verbal pursuit. At this point she turned back to the rest of the group to let them know when she took the reservation she had no idea they would be ordering so much food at the RESTAURANT and that she was going to put the order in before the kitchen closed, even though the group had asked she please wait until it was determined if there was even going to be an order. The conclusion was that, though they discovered they could have eaten the food, the beyond rude service dissuaded them from even bothering. 

The group was perplexed, insulted, hungry and fed up so they left to a very half hearted apology from the person who originally told them it would be no problem to take them after a 40 minute wait. They ate elsewhere and would never return. They would also never recommend this place to anyone else who wanted to spend several hundred dollars on wine and small plates, unless, of course, they wanted to spend that sort of money to be treated horribly. 

The end.
author: Drue C.

description: This place has an amazing selection of great wines and a great happy hour which allowed me to get to know the place and find wines that I want to have regardless of happy hour deals or not!
author: J B.

description:
Cafe Meuse is a low key little spot in Russian Hill, on a corner where you can watch the trolley and sleepy neighbors go by. If you're looking for a mellow spot to grab a glass of wine, this is the place for you. If you're looking for hip, urban surroundings, better to make your way over to Bacchus or Amelie nearby.

This turned out to be the perfect after-movie spot for two people to get to know each other better. It's not too loud, and it's quite cozy. Being one of those people who loves wine but never writes any names down, I was picking our server's brain for a nice non-tannic red, but the glass I ended up with was just average.

Maybe it's too much to ask for a life-changing wine? Or maybe they should employ a sommelier. Either way, I'll be back for Ladies Night on Wednesdays. Cuz this lady likes her wine and is determined to find "the one."
author: Nicole G.

description:
We were about 3 1/2 glasses of wine deep when Grace said, for the fourth time that night, that I have "gay tendencies."

Now of course, she backed it up by saying "all positive, the kind of tendencies that girls find attractive."

I was dejected none the less.  

I mean jeez, I dress well, I smell good (Banana Republic Black Walnut by the way, it rules), I am relatively "up" on what shoes look good on a woman, and I can spell Weitzman....sue me.  

That all being said, I stewed in my druken state and said to myself, no way, I am normal, I look like any ordinary guy and no one can tell me differently, Grace is just busting my balls and knocking me down a peg or two which she knows both bothers me and intrigues me at the same time.  

(That was a long sentence)

So, at around closing time, while Grace was inside for a minute, a super hip, super cool guy named James (who was a friend of the owner), came out to tell me I needed to hustle up because they were closing.  

In our conversation, James, a bastian of fashion know how and obviously gay man is talking my ear off about his choice of attire for the evening.  

What stopped him dead in his tracks?  

Me saying "no, no, I am not interested?"

Me saying "dude, you are killing me here?"

No, none of that.

What stopped him was him saying "DAMN!  Look at those shoes you are wearing, those are fantastic!  Boy, you have some style."

Right on James.  Right on.

Cafe Meuse is a cool place to hang out with a bottle of wine.  It's really nothing special but the bartender was pretty cool and the owner apparently let us stay well past closing.

Estrogen.
author: Archie R.

description: Really cute and cozy wine bar. Good selection and pretty tasty small plates.  Hidden but tottally worth it
author: Viola S.

description:
WOW!  This is definitely an untapped jewel for guys looking to meet super cute ladies.  Wednesday night is "ladies night"...two for one glasses of great wine.  I went last night and I was shocked as to how many cute girls were there and NO DUDES whatsoever. 
Great appetizers and a fantasic cheese platter with different types of cheeses, fruits and nuts.
I highly recommend all cute, available dudes take note!
author: Danielle V.

description:
My girlfriend and I visited Cafe Meuse for their 4th anniversary celebration and we were extremely impressed. The flight of 4 wines included generous pours, and the cheese plate with fresh and dried fruit and nuts was delectable. Service was friendly and knowledgeable, and Eric made the rounds with complimentary stuffed clams and mushrooms made by his mom Linda. 

The vibe at this place is best described as "neighborhoody" with plenty of folks stopping by our table to chat. Not a snob in the place, or if there was then they kept it to themselves.

When you go, try to sit in by the window: it's a perfect people-watching perch and once you have a glass in you, you'll even wave back to the tourists on the cable car line.

Which reminds me, don't even think of driving: Russian Hill is one of the most notorious neighborhood in which to park.
author: ChickCaesar S.

description:
While I am a huge fan of the concept of Ladies' Night at a bar, it is generally the bars that are rather unappetizing for ladies that roll out the red carpet. Even the siren song of free drinks is not enough to make me want to go to a sports bar or a third rate strip club. So imagine my surprise and delight to discover a great Ladies' Night at a charming little wine bar in Nob Hill.

Wednesday night at Cafe Meuse = two for one glasses of wine for the ladies. The wine list has some great selections, the pours are dangerously generous and the bar staff is really friendly.  We were there the night before Thanksgiving so we basically had the run of the place, but I imagine it gets a little more crowded on a regular Wednesday night.

This would be a great place for a date as well.
author: Angie R.

description:
Wine is my muse.  After one glass, the world is a better place and I am completely inspired.  I cook fastastic , flavorful meals when I'm two glasses deep.  I listen to music and dance around my apartment.  I paint, I read classics and write Yelp reviews.  Actually I do that anyway, but it just feels soooo right after a flight.  

Last night after a glass of Prosecco and a crisp Alsacian pinot blanc at Cafe Meuse, I booked a flight to New Orleans (200 dolla dolla bills, y'all!) and cooked jambalaya while listening to Dr. John.  

Cafe Meuse (the French river, not the goddess) is a small Nob Hill wine bar nestled on the corner of Hyde and Pacific.  Wednesday is 2 for 1 ladies night, so the quaint venue fills up quickly!  We enjoyed a yummy smoked salmon appetizer with dill-infused cheese and crostini.  6 morsels for two classy lasses was the perfect amount to prevent us from acting silly and still save room for the culinary motivation bestowed on us by Bacchus.  

I will be back on Wednesdays to come, enjoying 2 for 1 and expecting nothing short of an epiphany.
author: Kerry D.

description:
Oh yes it's ladies night
And the feeling's right
Oh yes it's ladies night
Oh what a night, oh what a night!

I LOVE this place!  Its a great size, nice simple decor, great neighborhood location (corner of Pacific & Hyde so great people watching if you get a window seat), and how can you beat Wed. ladies night 2 for 1?!  The wine selection is fantastic and right up my alley... the first two whites on the list... Rieslings!  The fourth and the fifth whites... Gewrztraminers!  If you have a question the waitress/sommelier is very knowledgeable, gives good advice and is really friendly to boot!  They also give quite generous pours, no gypping you on wine here.  The food is delish as well... from the nicely presented cheese plate to the tasty artichoke dip.    

Mark my words, I will become a regular... at least for ladies night!
author: Ms. M. M.

description: We were staying in the city for a few days and found this place on our first night out.  Great wine and good selection of  small  food  plates.  The owner spent time chatting with us and was happy to let us sample a taste of the wine before selecting.  Decor inside reminded me of those romantic little wine bars you find in Paris.  Enjoyed this so much we came back the second night for the cheese plate and was surprised with a free dessert as they remembered it was our anniversary!  Pretty impressive to say we had only been there once before.  This place is a gem and you should check it out.  It's located on Pacific Ave right on the main Hyde cable car line.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Popped in here last Friday night on a whim with a girlfriend when we just didn't want to deal with the crowds on Polk. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the bar was nearly empty. The wine list was diverse but not overwhelming, and we both really enjoyed our selections. I also had the bruschetta at the recommendation of the waitress - it did not disappoint! 

This is a great bar for a quiet night out, and a great casual date spot. I also can't wait to come to the 2 for 1 ladies night with the girls!
author: Kelly C.

description:
My BF and I stopped here on our way to Hyde Street Seafood House on Friday night. It was surprisingly warm out so, despite it still being gloomy, we decided to sit outside. We walked into Cafe Meuse and it was oddly hot inside. I mean it was seriously about 90 degrees so I was glad we decided to sit outside. We ordered a bottle of sparkling rose from the friendly bartender and she offered to bring it out to our table for us. It was really tasty and I'll probably go back for the same $35 bottle. The wine prices seem to include tax as my bill was exactly $35. 

I will be heading back to Meuse (possibly for 2 for 1 Ladies night on Thursday!) for the awesome ambiance next time I head over to this awesome stretch of Hyde Street.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Yay!  This cafe replaces the old cafe at the same spot.  New owner, new management, new name, new look - and it's a winner.

The space has been completely redesigned and is comfy and lovely.  A $5 wine special was delicious.  The redone interior is inviting, cozy, clean and modern, the staff friendly.

Note that it transform from a regular cafe in the daytime to a bistro in the evenning.  Limited but delicious bistro menu and nice wine selection.

Welcome, Cafe Meuse!
author: Rose Q.

description:
Has anyone noticed that what passes for an attractive girl in the russian hill/nob hill/marina area is quite often not attractive to most people with the gift of sight? I've been subtly noticing this for awhile, but tonight at Cafe Meuse, I noticed many Russian Hill/ Nob Hill regulars...you know the ones....highlights, poofy oversized arty top, thin, but fucked up faces. I mean, like if they gave out badges for "women destined to be aunts" or "women destined to be ex-wives', these would be the ones. I guess the kids would calll it butterface.

Anyway, I go to this place....totally charming, one of those many places in the Hyde St. / Pacific Ave area....smells nice, cool lighting. I feel like it would be perfec to go here after Christmas shopping. However, the wine list was mediocre. The wine server was attentive but doesn't know the difference between attentive and interrupt you and your friends constantly. The food was ok but nothing special.

So, go here to drop in for a quick glass of wine or if you are in severe need of ambience. If you want great wines or great food, go to Uva, or even Brick, or some of the many wonderful food and wine bars in the city. This to me seems like a place I would go at age 25 thinking I was very suave and sophisticated. If you are age 25 or less and not versed in the ways of food and wine, take a date here and have a great night. If you are above that age or savvy, or both, then skip it unless you just want to duck in for a bit.

Am I bitchy? Maybe. I think if you read my other reviews you'll think this one is fair. Judge for yourself. At the end of the day, it's your life, as Karl Pilkington would say.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Has potential...  The food is pretty tasty.  Great warm toasty bread.  Great tomato soup with crab meat.

It'd be much nicer if the middle parts of the windows were opaqued or clouded out, so it'd be more cozy and intimate to match their classy wine bar theme.
author: Melanie C.

description:
This has become my favorite new happy hour place--especially for Ladies Night on Wednesdays.  I was unpleasantly surprised to see quite a crowd this week, so it looks like the secret's out and now I can safely review this little spot.  The bartender is so nice.  She goes out of her way to make you feel like you're the only one in there.  We sat in these little chairs by the bathroom (there weren't any tables!) and she magically appeared with the bottles that we were drinking just as our glasses went dry.  My friend went out to smoke at their cute outdoor tables later on, and the bartender brought her a lighter and an ashtray.  Where in the city do you find a restaurant that will do THAT?  

The people are nice, the atmosphere is cute, the food is delicious, the service is fantastic and the wine list always has something that I'm dying to drink on it.  

Five enthusiastic stars!
author: Katie D.

description:
Pretty sweet deal on Wed night.  I didn't understand (thus the 3 stars, I'm sure my rating will improve next time.)  Wed is Ladies Night (buy one get one free.)  So I went with my roommate and we each ordered a glass of wine and then asked for the bill.  We thought we would get one glass free but its 2 for 1 PER PERSON!  I'll have to go back to redeem myself.

The wine we fabulous though and the place is pretty small but also very shiek, good place to catch up with a friend.

EDIT:
I came here a second time with another friend but my star rating still stands.  The wine is tasty and we ordered a cheese plate as well.  But its just so pricey.  I don't think I'd ever go on any nigh but Wed.  And I guess guys are just screwed.  

Also the place is pretty small.  I came with a friend I really wanted to catch up with and and the more full it got the louder it got.  I could barely hear my friend.

Overall, I'd much rather go to Amelie, just a few blocks away.
author: Angela S.

description:
Decently priced wine bar in the Russian hill area. Definately a certain type of crowd. Not a pick up joint, odd as it seems that there always attractive single women in the place.

Great for one quick glass on your way home.
author: Brian M.

description:
I absolutely adore this place.  I almost hesitate to review it, because so far it's not overly crowded and I like it that way.  My friend and I stumbled upon this place on New Year's Eve because the party we were going to was across the street, and loved it.
