Now we go every Wednesday when they have a 2-for-1 Ladies Night special on wine.  Rebecca, the kind and funny woman behind the bar, remembers our names and chats with us every time we come in.  She also hand makes the desserts every day, which are always delicious.  We also always order the $13 cheese platter, which features Manchego, Cotswald Cheddar, Brie, and Blue cheeses, along with dried and fresh fruit, nuts, and crackers.  Best deal in cheese plates in the city.
This is my go-to place for a lovely, homey evening where I always know I will feel welcome and have a good time.
author: Dana B.

description:
If I could give half stars, I'd go with a 3.5. I'm a huge fan of the Ladies Night 2 for 1 on Thursday. It's the only night I go, but I visit fairly often since it's in my hood. There are some hits and misses on the wine list in my opinion: the Cabernet  is a winner but skip the Zin (too fruity). 

As for apps, the olives with feta are great. Bummer about the skimpy salad, though. Saucer size = too small. The cheese plate is solid but unremarkable. I agree with others that the seating could be comfier, but kudos for the custom made tables. 

The last .5 star is for the cucumber water. Details count.
author: Leah Y.

description: Great neighborhood spot with good wine and a friendly staff. Nice place to meet friends or have a drink on your own.
author: Lisa K.

description:
A great little hidden gem in the city. Meuse quiet lil location makes it the perfect romantic wine bar if you are looking to impress a lady. Its also very cloak and dagger. I always imagine it to be a foggy night and a cut through the fog in a cab looking to meet up with a secret agent at Meuse to discuss an assassination attempt on the president of fill in any country. Of course we meet at Meuse...its quiet, there are no CIA operatives and the great wine and food is a good cover! 

Then i wake up and I am greeted by wine barista all star Rebecca with some wine and one of her delicious cookies. Sure she is no secret agent but she does a great job of making you feel welcome. I highly recommend this spot!!!

Not much parking...take a cab
author: Ahmad R.

description:
I love this place.. yes, because it's less than a block from my place.. but also the staff is friendly, and usually have good suggestions of what to try by the glass, and the food is yummy.. using seasonal ingredients... so the menu does change a little often. The only time I'm not happy here is when they are packed.. 'spose that's good for bizness :o)

If you get desperate for parking there is a lot at Polk & Pacific next to the Jug Shop. Not sure how late it is open.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Hands down to this place for being able to cater to my BFF's b-day bash with 20+ guests. Venue is not too big so it seemed like we took over.

Service was fantastic as they were willing to accommodate with any request and the food was great for the price. My fave is the prosciutto wrapped figs....I can pop 10 of these things.

Parking can be tough but at least there are lots on Polk St.
author: Katie K.

description:
I want to give Meuse 3.5 stars

Just to put it out there - Something about Meuse felt weird to me.  There are plenty of reasons why I might have felt like this - but I think mainly it is that while its a small space with only about 7 or 8 tiny tables and the bar - the servers were insanely busy and made me nervous.  Of course they were both sweet and friendly but why did it take 20 minutes to get some bread with my glass of wine?  

The cheese plate was pretty, i admit - but so dull.  Cheese plates should be exciting and should include weird random cheeses you haven't had before.  Otherwise I can buy them in bulk from Safeway - like these cheeses: goat cheese, gouda, bleu and  brie.  BORING!! and for $14 not so much of a deal.

Meuse is a nice to place to sit in the corner and have a wine.   Don't sit at the bar, it will make you anxious.  Oh!  I almost forgot, I took the cable car there which worked out fine, but it took my friend a full 45 minutes to park.  It's impossible to park - to reiterate.  Do not drive here.
author: Dana M.

description: I love this place.  It's relaxed atmosphere sets the mood for a relaxed evening with friends or a date.  Unlike some nearby "wine bars", this place doesn't use the playlist from your favorite dance club which, inevitably, attracts the city's biggest tools that are soaked in their favorite cologne and dawning their favorite Ed Hardy attire.  (Cough)... @meli3.  The staff are very friendly, they have a decent wine list and the very tasty appetizers never disappoint!  Living 100 yards away Is just icing on the cake!  So, if you're looking for a glass of vino without the obnoxious frat crowd, then check this place out and tip them well!
author: Todd S.

description:
I love stopping off here after dinner for a glass of dessert wine and a truffle. Their homemade whip cream with strawberries was also delicious.

I love the firendly service here and the atmosphere is perfect for an evenly chat over a glass of wine with my fiance.

This is truly our neighborhood wine bar. It exudes San Francisco charm and is near all of the great Hyde street restuarants.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
I love this place. The wine selection is awesome, the atmosphere is definitely fun but relaxed. The servers are friendly and like to chat. Its typically filled with neighborhood residents and the occassional strays from the cable car. 

Wednesday nights get pretty busy, but a calm Monday or Thursday is where its at.
author: Jenn G.

description:
Thursday's Ladies Night is not really your typical ladies night at a bar.  I think of ladies night being advertised to bring in the guys, but really it was just groups of girls catching up and the one couple at a table alternating between over the top PDA and being on their phones separately.

The great deal on Thursdays is 2 for 1 wines, which makes their wine super affordable.  Unfortunately there are no food specials.  Overall, worth it for the wine, but it was tough to get our waitress's attention sometimes.
author: Olivia T.

description:
I love the Russian Hill neighborhood and Cafe Meuse is another reason for my infatuation with the 'hood (and SF, of course!).  This wonderfully cozy, dimly lit wine bar offers generous pours of various wines (and beers) in a setting that is seriously romantic. I thought for a moment that I was in Paris!
There is even a couch to lounge on and plenty of tables in darker corners for those special conversations :).

The table service was friendly and very quick. Huge props to Cafe Meuse for keeping the music low enough for conversation.  We WILL be back to visit!
author: Rick L.

description: Cute little wine bar on Nob Hill. Very cozy atmostphere, the prices are very reasonable and the food is good! Wines by the glass ($8-$11), even better with the $2 off at happy hour (5PM-7PM).  I really liked the peanut chicken satay, very flavorful!  Very relaxing atmostphere, service can be a bit slow, but let's be honest, no one is in a hurry at a wine bar!
author: Marissa P.

description: Super cute place! Small and chill....the perfect place for a glass of wine before dinner! And their Happy Hour is fantastic!
author: Jamie K.

description: I've been here twice- once on a date & once with friends and liked it a lot both times. I've never had any of the eats, but they have a great wine list and friendly servers. I like neighborhood & the atmosphere a lot- it's right on the corner of Hyde & Pacific so the cable car goes by outside & is in a good location to people watch. Want to try & make it to Ladies Night on a Wednesday...
author: Jenna R.

description: Great wine list that changes often. The owner, Eric is the sweetest and most hospitable. You'll feel like you've known him for years. The food selection is on the lighter side, but better than most wine bars.  Very tasty compliments to the array of wine. Great for a date night, GNO (especially Thursdays for Ladies' Night), or event taking clients and parents!
author: Susanna S.

description:
Great place to meet my best lady to catch up. It's in her neighborhood so it's totally convenient.  It wasn't crowded and the music was just right for talking. 
The wine list is nice and not overwhelming. The girl who was working  was a doll. she even brought us fresh baked bread even though we weren't having dinner there.
  We will definitely check out ladies night on Wednesday's 2 for 1!
author: Douggers M.

description:
This is a great addition to the Hyde St. bars/restaurants.  Small but cozy place that gets is great to meet a friend to catch up, or a group of friends to chill at.  Staff are attentive and the owner is always there.  Later in the evening you will find him waltzing with some ladies or just chatting at the bar with his customers. Lots of regulars here! 

Wednesday night is LADIES NIGHTS!  Ladies - buy a glass of wine get the second glass FREE!!!  MEN - that means Wed. is the night to go caused LOTS of ladies to pick up on!  

Tapas dishes are yummy too!  The owner is the chef and has a bit of asian influences -- ahi tartare is sooo good!
author: Lily W.

description:
It's interesting to see so many high reviews here since when I went this past Saturday night around 9:30 p.m., it was not a happening spot-- all the business was over across the street at the other wine bar (which we went to but didn't want to wait 30 minutes for a table).  

This place is okay-- prices are pretty reasonable and there's a nice selection of wine.  The Anthony Hammond riesling (2004) was a lovely dessert wine ($8 per glass, $33 per bottle).  The waiter was very helpful in suggesting some wines based on our preferences-- not pretentious at all-- and let us sample a chardonnay and something else before we decided on the riesling.  Also shared the caramel chocolate pot de creme-- it was a little too sweet (this coming from a girl with a serious sweet tooth).  

There wasn't much ambience but it was nice to have the place more or less to ourselves, and the window seats offer a nice view of the cable cars and pedestrians passing by.
author: Lynn O.

description: The wine was great and the people were so friendly we had a great time at Cafe Meuse and will be back soon. It a different kind of world in this location but we open our eyes to different kind of  life style.
author: Bailey J.

description: Great little place!! Great service and 2 dollars off wine glasses at happy hour. A tad on the pricey side but we are in sf. We almost expect that here. Come for the service they are real friendly!
author: L. ..

description: Great service, good wine, yummy food, and it's in a weird enough nook of Russian hill that the crowd is sparse and polite.
author: Tim M.

description:
Dear Awkward,
I am writing you this letter because I don't think we should see each other anymore. Every wine bar or lounge that I go to you are there making me feel like I'm at a singles party and I'm the only one invited. I didn't miss your absence today, Awkward, because Cafe Meuse is a little piece of heaven to relax the soul and body with soothing tunes, delicious wine and food that will require lots of counseling and patience to break the temptation from coming back for more. A fantastic wine list and a beautiful and sweet wine tender, Shannon, that has a smile that would make god blush..This place is classy but not in anyway snobby. Eric and Shannon will crack jokes and make you laugh but won't lack professional integrity. 
I highly recommend this place to someone that has their first date or someone that wants to simply relax and enjoy themselves.. I wish I had an extra star that I could give this place because it is simply divine but yelp won't let me give Cafe Meuse a 10 so I'll settle for a 5.
P.S. the appetizers are to die for.. I personally like the chicken in a peanut sauce. Ive never known such an addiction until now.
Thank you Cafe Meuse
author: Bradley P.

description: I tried this place twice.  I really wanted to like it - I mean, the decor is nice and the wine is good, however it can be a bit pricey & it's always SO QUIET - there's really no atmosphere.
author: Heidi B.

description:
Wednesday night ladies night.  

I walk by this place every single day.  I FINALLY decided to stop in with a co-worker.  We ordered the Artichoke Spinich Dip.  It was DELICIOUS!  I will go back just for that.  The wine was well, wine.  Love wine... whether it be 2 buck chuck or a bottle of the finest.  Doesn't matter to this cat.  

I LOVED the fact that we were listening to Eminem.  HAHAHA... I didn't expect that.  But that's what made it cool.

I went back last Wednesday bringing 3 co-workers.  For the 3 of us, we had a cheese platter (honestly a lil over priced - $14- worth $11... yeah not a huge difference, but kinda is) and an app of Figs.  I missed the artichoke dip.  But, all in all, we spent $18 a person including tip for 2 glasses of wine EACH and 2 apps.  I think that's a GREAT DEAL if you ask me.  

We'll go back again soon!
author: Noneya B.

description:
If you are a wine enthusiast, want to learn about great quality varietals or if you just want to have a great time in a local wine bar with a lively atmosphere, then I highly recommend that you DO NOT go to CAFE MEUSE.

Cafe Meuse was a joke from the first moment I walked in on a sunny Saturday afternoon.  The host who displayed no knowledge of wine, addressed me as BRO.  I have no idea why.  My Brothers don't even call me BRO.  Additionally, The young lady asked me what I wanted to drink before even presenting me with a menu.  when I asked for a couple of minuets to think my decision over she asked me if I would prefer a beer.  Can anyone tell me who goes to a wine bar to DRINK BEER!

The young lady was a classless host in a classless bar.  Living in the Bay Area, we are too close to wine country and have many other promising options to waste our time, energy and money on such an establishment.  Please heed this warning, do not waste your time.  This wine bar will be obsolete in no time and you would have missed nothing.
author: Venney B.

description: I love these tiny little wine bars tucked in little corners around Hyde St. It's another intimate, cozy little place to have a quiet glass of wine with a date, or to bring some friends for the 2-for-1 ladies night. It's not too snooty or expensive, which is good because I am not that classy. We shared a bottle of chardonnay, and watched the trolley go by.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Great neighborhood wine bar. The wine is always flowing, the small plates menu has something for everyone and the staff/owner are extremely helpful AND friendly. I am always eager to check out their daily wines by the glass. Cozy inside seating for the colder months and a table in the sun for SF's summer.
author: Rachel S.

description: Me and G went here last night after we got our eyebrows done and wanted to catch a drink before our dinner reservations. This place was really cute and was exactly what we were looking for. The ambiance was really chill and low key. We both ordered some wine along with olives and feta cheese...mmmmmmm yummmy!!!!!!! Great place....would definitely do it again......
author: Niki F.

description: Nice cute place.  We had a few snacks and some vino during their ladies nights.  So I gotta say this, guys need to check this place out on a weds.  The entire place was FULL of attractive women getting sauced from their two for one deal.  What more could a guy ask for?.....not in the perverted pick up on super drunk chicks sort of way.  The service was fantastic and the nibbles were pretty tasty too.  it's definitely one of those places I could do monthly with my gaggles of girls.  I would also check it out sans deal.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Pretty solid wine bar with good selection. Desserts are pretty tasty too. We came on Monday, and wine bottles are 25% off! Wasn't crowded (it has like 10 tables in total) and was very relaxing. Nice and pleasant ambience. Ended up with a 2009 Pinot Noir from Willamette Valley. Pretty smooth and pleasant for the $40 (after discount) wine!
author: Jacky L.

description: Solid beer on draght.  Yeah, that's right.  Sometimes I just can't do a Syrah or Cab Sav after a hard day of answering emails & photocopying stuff.  I effing need a cold beer.  And if I wanna do that in a quaint, but classy wine bar in Nob/Russian Hill....I'm coming here.
author: Robby T.

description: cute and cozy wine bar on hyde street. they have a good special for ladies night and a good option if you want a low key night with your girlfriends.
author: Helen T.

description: This place is adorable and wonderful. If ever you are strolling along Hyde Street in the arms of your better half stop into Cafe Meuse for a glass of wine and delicious appetizers. It is a small and intimate spot perfect for catching up with people you love. The table tops are made of wine crate panels and the service was friendly and attentive. Their wine selection is small but delightful. Everything on their menu looked delicious but we settled on the crab cakes which were great. They get a gold star for the bread and dipping oil. They bring out a warm ciabatta roll and a blend of olive oil, balsamic vinegar and garlic to dip it in...DELICIOUS!
author: Sugey G.

description: "Cute little neighborhood wine bar. A tad pricey but apparently there's a Wed nite 2 for 1 for Ladies...so that could be a deal"
author: Jocelyn L.

description: We had a lovely romantical evening here before meeting some friends for din din.  We were able to take advantage of the happy hour deal ( 5-7 pm  - $2 off glasses of vino) while sitting in the window watching SF go by (and some chump doing a horrible parking job, boxing another fella in) .  The goat cheese and ciabatta is a nice little snack.
author: Emily W.

description: $45 on two small plates and six glasses of wine? You know where to find me on a Wednesday night...
author: Natalie T.

description:
loved it. cute, cozy lil spot with a nice wine selection and yummy small plates. i really enjoyed the chicken satay and spinach artichoke dip. nice pours too, not skimpy at all. so for $9 or $10 a glass you at least feel you are getting your dollars worth. 

the service was friendly and attentive, and they played nice, if somewhat generic music, altho they did turn it up a bit too loud after 9, it's not like the place was packed and called for it, but it wasn't annoying enough to detract from the experience. i have a good friend in the hood, so i'm thinking this will be our go-to place when i visit her.
author: rachel p.

description: I had a great time here last Thursday for Ladies' Night. The two for one special was awesome and the food was delicious, especially the bread that was served. I swear, it tasted like a fresh baked cookie!  The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and I will definitely be back. Thanks for a good time Cafe Meuse!
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Came here on Wednesday (ladies night) and the waitress told us it was the busiest they have ever been. We were able to snag a cute sidewalk table, but the kitchen seemed a little over-burdened by the crowd. They were out of the warmed figs appetizer (bummer-- I might have to come back for that one) and the small plates we did order took a long time to arrive. The wine, however, appeared promptly in generously-sized glasses, and was an especially good deal given that it was 2-for-1 ladies night.  I had a great Pinot Noir and a Syrah for about $10 total, and our waitress was very apologetic about the wait for the food. All in all, definitely worth checking out.
author: Chelsea R.

description: So I this Wednesday a friend and I decide to hit up Cafe Meuse for Ladies Night...The place was packed and we were enjoying our 2 for 1 wine....or so we thought. After properly indulging in wine our bill came - we both almost fell off our chairs - apparently they moved Ladies night to Thursday night - nice. I only wish they would have updated the sign!  It's still a cute spot but nook is a block away and has happy hour every night!!!
author: Summer C.

description: I will miss you guys when I move... you are so close to me now. Service is always great. Eric taught me some dance moves. Great wine! Fun times!!! I will hike up the hill to see you guys - Stop by you won't be disappointed. BTW - they have the best warm bread and I love the tomato crab soup! I could use some right now!!! xoxo Guys!!!
author: Jodi B.

description: Let's get real here.  This place wants to be a cute little wine bar, but it falls short in all those things that make actual cute little wine bars what they are.  Comfort, simplicity, a touch of class, service.  This place lacks comfortable seating.  The bar doesn't have a counter top/overhang (this is hard to describe), so your knees keep hitting up against the bar.  It's annoying!  The wine selection is not great and the nibbles are so so.  I felt like it was a knock-off...much like the purses that I love to buy when I'm in NY or Korea...of other wine bars around the city.  Ack.  It's got a convenient locations...right by my bus stop...so yeah, I'll probably go again.  so, I'll shut up now.
author: Susan L.

description: Nice place... Good wine, ambiance, and good food.  Some of the selections seem a bit out of place (roast beef sandwich) but otherwise, all around good spot.  Kudos for being two blocks from my house.
author: Calvin N.

description: This is a great little spot for wine in Nob Hill. My girlfriend and I discovered this place thanks to Yelp and loved it. The staff was very friendly and it was filled with locals having a good time. Great ambiance with appropriate music playing. It's a very small place though so I'm not sure how easy it always is to get a seat.
author: Dave K.

description: This place is great for a late night drink, with friends and/or your significant other. There's both indoor and outdoor seating, although the inside seating is a bit more intimate with dimly lit lights and candles on the tables. The wine selection is great and even serves beer in both bottles and on draught. I definitely recommend this place if your looking for a cool chill spot to have a few drinks with friends... or lovers!
author: Christina D.

description: Love this place. Went last week on a blind date and it was the perfect atmosphere. The Argentinian Malbec was delicious and so was the beet salad. We sat outside and the waitress was still very tentative even though she was slammed. Can't wait to go back.
author: Emily A.

description: This place was absolutely adorable! Not being a wine fan myself, and preferring liquor, we were wandering with our dogs around our neighborhood and wanted somewhere with outside seating...the cute candle lit tables outside were perfect, the weather was great, and the sparkling wine we got was as close to wine i'd like as possible!  All in all, totally adorable, neighborhood feel and I can't wait to go back! Ladies night sounds nice too, but it was perfect for a low key drink outside on a monday night...
author: Danielle J.

description: It's a small, quaint little place to stop by for a quick wine fix.  Although the place is small and there's nothing too memorable about the decor, the selection of wines is quite good.  And 2 for 1 ladies night on Wednesday?  Score!  That's convinced me to go back.
author: Naomi N.

description: Good wine list; decent (but not great) service. We'll see how they do on the next visit (it's good enough that there will be one). I hear Wednesday is the night to go -- for ladies, anyway. I'm intrigued enough that I'll return.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Meuse is a nice spot in the middle of the wine bar-ghetto that is Nob Hill. I've found the wines by the glass selection is a little conventional, though they did have an interesting sparkling red Shiraz from Australia the last time I went in. The water is great. I know that sounds random but it really is a highlight. They infuse cucumber in their water, which gives it a great flavor. Single guys might want to check out Wednesdays-- ladies night seems to be popular ;)
author: Andrew M.

description: This place is tiny. The food is average but the drinks menu is pretty good. As far as 'Ladies Night' goes, guys, that's what it is. Don't be fooled by some reviews that say, 'you should go to meet attractive women here'. They are attractive but they're there for 'ladies' night, meaning no dudes are wanted. Unless you're willing to fork a few hundred dollars worth of food and drinks towards them. And what the hell is up with the chicken skewers with peanut butter on them as sauce? It's seriously JIF peanut butter. Very creative!
author: Javan E.

description:
I went here as part my Valentines evening festivities with a woman I was seeing (and I'm still seeing...I think.  Women are complicated).  How was the wine?  I vaguely recall it being pretty good; well, I had enough to not remember exactly, so it must have been pretty good, huh.

The ambiance is memorable, though: cute and romantic, a perfect fit for the vibe I was looking for that evening.

The staff was friendly and unobtrusive.  And the staff is nice and (for us anyways) flexible on closing time (which I think someone else mentioned in a prior review).  My date and I started making out a bit and we didn't realize it was getting late until we looked up and saw we were the only ones left at a table :)

So, mad props to Cafe Meuse!!!
author: T L.

description: Three of my girlfriends and I were looking for the place to start out our typical ladies night out. So with the suggestion of one of our friends we decided to indulge in the two for one "Ladies Night" at Cafe Meuse. When we arrived our two friends already had a table. Our watress was very attentive and brought us our wine promptly. We also ordered the Cheese platter and the Spinach Artichtoke dip, both very delish! I ordered the Sangeiovese and the Syrah, both pretty decent and not too pricey like some other Wine bars in SF. We all had our fill of wine and food and we were amazed when paying the bill how inexpensive it was. I'll definately be back here, great spot to grab a glass of wine and catch up with friends.
author: Sarah R.

description: Lovely little neighborhood gem. Dark, deep woods and homey feeling decor. Not super trendy or 'cool' but it hits the spot for a girls night of wine, small bites and gossip to catch up on the week's up and downs of love, work and life. We were on our way to Amelie but didn't feel like walking all the way and saw a sign for 'ladies night' so we decided we'd make  detour which ended up taking all night. We started with a cheese plate and I had a pinot grigio - my favorite so i stuck with it for the rest of the night. The date tried a few others all of which she was happy with. The cheese plate was impressive, several cheese, fruits, bread and honey in the middle which was the perfect compliment. We each had a salad, both of which hit the spot. We stayed for at least 2 hours and were very comfortable in what felt like a dark living room/dining room with friendly patient service. Definitely a good place to come with a buddy, not really the best date place. This will be a regular of mine since it's only a block from my house and their thursday special is quite tempting.
author: Audrey V.

description: This is a great spot for a glass of wine and good conversation.  Its a cozy atmosphere, they always recommend great wine, and the dessert is good.  A great place for a nice night out.
author: Carly G.

description: Enjoy the happy hour. The wines are a bit pricy. Its a nice place to sit and have a quiet conversation.
author: Steve T.

description: I stumbled upon this spot while waiting to meet a friend for dinner. Needless to say, i was very impressed by the wine selection, food menu and staff. The bar feels comfortable. It's the type of spot that you can enjoy a nice glass of wine and conversation. The bartender, Rebbecca, was awesome. Definitely recommend.
author: Paul H.

description: Good date place.  Romantic, candle-lit atmosphere.  Quaint, appropriate music.  Food was quite good, as was the service.
author: Christopher P.

description: Great little place on Nob Hill for wine and appies.  2 for 1 wine specials on Wednesday Ladies night and a great selection of wines.  The only downside to the place is that it is a bit small and the bar is kind of awkward...try standing instead of sitting and you won't feel like an idiot.  Will definitely be going there again!
author: Erin F.

description: Nice LITTLE wine bar on Hyde st.  the food is good, the atmosphere is cozy with some nice outdoor seating.  Small creative menu with a good wine list.  Enjoyed the small dinner i had there and will be back for some more soon.
author: S T.

description: We had a reservation for a party of eleven people and it's a very small place. They basically stuck a bunch of table that were designed for two together to make one big table.  We were a little cramped. However the service was very good. There was one waitress servicing the whole place and she never stopped moving. The menu is limited but we tried lots of items and everything was good, especially the tomato soup and chicken satay. I tried several wines and nothing blew me away, but all were fairly decent.
author: Paul S.

description: I really like this place. Great small dishes, fun and classy atmosphere, good wine and nice people. Eric from Cafe Meuse once accepted a delivery for me without even knowing me (I live across the street), and when I went to pick it up introduced himself and shook my hand. Nice!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Good wine and a place to gather that is not too pretentious.  I love the cheese plate.  What else do I have to say?  Cheese.  mmmmm!
author: jessica d.

description: I want to like this place, because it's cute and charming. But every single time I've been there (each time convinced I would have a better experience), service has been horrendous - downright rude, in fact. Look, there's no need for attitude - you work at the bar, I'm here to partake in drinks, no need for you to be snobby. Really. I've come here at all different times - late afternoon, late evening - regardless of how many customers there are, it's so hard to get served. Peace out.
author: Lemon S.

description:
this place was a definite let down.

my husband and i are regular wine drinkers and know a tiny bit about wine, and were stoked to see our local wine bar had a wednesday ladies night deal. we decided to go here over a couple of our other favs (hidden vine, rouge et blanc) because its so cute and so close to our house.

first, we had the roederer sparkling....which i had earlier this week too. something about it at this joint tasted really, well, flat. 

we moved to whites and to reds and nothing really sang.

we had the cheese and charcuterie plate ($20), which was not very generous or very good. there were only 2 cheese, both in the bleu family which didn't seem very exciting. the meats were good, but again, for $20 you expect more. I had the same thing at Rouge et Blanc earlier this week, for the same price and it was cowgirl creamery cheeses, excellent meats, olives, fun condiments that truly compliment the cheeses (mustard should not have been the only condiment on that plate at cafe meuse).

the chevre & crostini and beef carpaccio plates were good, but not at all exciting.

with 8 glasses of wine (a couple of which were free for me) and a few plates it was over $100. say what??!!!?? normally it would seem fair...but...

we felt like it was pricey for the such poor quality. the gal serving was super sweet, but scattered towards the end of the night and it took a while to get out of there.

the ladies night deal is great, but the quality of the wines, getting info about them and the food is not very good. go for 2, get one free, then definitely eat somewhere else. 

i don't think we'll ever go back, which sucks since we're long time local residents in that neighborhood.
author: Lady L.

description: Cute place to pop in for a quick drink and a small bit to eat.  Nice wine list, quiet (when we were in there - 2 other tables had people just reading).  Good people watching.  I wouldn't spend an entire evening here but it's a nice stop either before or after dinner or other event in the neighborhood.
author: L F.

description: A great place! Great food and the cozy and laid back atmosphere make this place great for a quiet meal by yourself or perfect atmosphere for a date any night of the week.
author: Peter R.

description: we strolled in here on a rainy sunday night looking to escape the weather and indulge in some wine and sweets. it was, all in all, the perfect location for both. adorable decor inside: small tables around the bar, tons of flickering candles on each, and in between the wine bottles on the shelves. our bartender/server was kind, knowledgeable and helpful. if you're looking for the perfect light dessert to enjoy with a bold glass of cab/syrah/zin, i more then recommend the strawberries and chantilly cream...just great! it's a nice place for couples, and the unattached -- it's relaxed, comfortable, warm and sure to please. yay! i'm a fan.
author: Cameron J.
